H0.text: Lipid is the class of molecule to which an enzyme in the Golgi apparatus catalyzes the addition of phosphates.

H1.text: Carbohydrate is the class of molecule that an enzyme in the Golgi apparatus catalyzes to receive phosphates.

H2.text: Nucleic acid is the class of molecule to which an enzyme in the Golgi apparatus catalyzes the addition of phosphates.

H3.text: Protein is the class of molecule to which an enzyme in the Golgi apparatus catalyzes the addition of phosphates.

A4.text: phosphorylation of oligosaccharides on lysosomal proteins occurs in the early CGN

A5.text: Other general post-translational modifications of proteins include the addition of carbohydrates (glycosylation) and phosphates (phosphorylation)
